required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Tolerability of ESO-101 in Patients With Eosinophilic Esophagitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Trial Evaluating the Efficacy, Tolerability and Safety of ESO-101 in Adult Patients With Active Eosinophilic Esophagitis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind trial to evaluate the efficacy, tolerability, and safety of ESO-101 in adult patients with active eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE). Patients will be screened at 2 visits (Visit 1 and Visit 2) during which their eligibility will be assessed based on endoscopy-independent criteria (Visit 1) and based on the histologic assessment of esophageal biopsy samples taken during the screening endoscopy (Visit 2). Eligible patients will be randomized 2:1 to once-daily treatment with ESO-101 or placebo and treated for 28 days starting on Day 0. Further clinic visits will be performed at Day 14 (Visit 4) and Day 28 (Visit 5, end of treatment) to assess the efficacy, tolerability, and safety. In addition, a safety follow-up call will be scheduled 2 weeks after the end of treatment (Day 42, Visit 6).

study_design_info.masking_description: The placebo will be identical to the test product in terms of appearance, constitution of inactive ingredients, packaging, labeling and administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute change in peak eosinophil count from Baseline to end of treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
primary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with histological remission, defined as the reduction of peak eosinophil count in all esophageal samples to <15 eosinophils/hpf at end of treatment, overall and determined differentially in each of the 3 esophageal segments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Biopsy samples will be taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5). At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields (hpfs) with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a peak eosinophil count in all esophageal samples of <6 eosinophils/hpf at end of treatment, overall and determined differentially in each of the 3 esophageal segments
secondary_outcome.description: Biopsy samples will be taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5). At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields (hpfs) with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with an improvement in the dysphagia severity score from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 28 days after Visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate the dysphagia severity score daily on a 11-point NRS (numeric rating scale): 0 = 'no symptoms' to 10 = 'worst possible symptoms'. At Visit 3 (Day 0) and Visit 5 (end of treatment), the worst severity scores out of the 7 days preceding the respective visit will be used for the assessment. The score assessed at Visit 3 (Day 0) at the center before IMP intake will serve as baseline score. Patients will additionally assess the severity score of the actual day in the patient diary daily after IMP intake starting on Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute change in mean eosinophil count from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in mean eosinophil count from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a relative reduction in peak eosinophil count of ≥30 percent from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a relative reduction in peak eosinophil count of ≥50 percent from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a relative reduction in peak eosinophil count of ≥75 percent from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Histology results of the biopsies at Visit 2 will be considered baseline values. For the peak number of eosinophils, hematoxylin and eosin stained esophageal biopsy specimen will be assessed and the high-powered fields with the highest density of eosinophils will be counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with histological remission AND improvement in the dysphagia severity score from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2 + 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The processing and analysis of biopsy samples taken at Visit 2 and end of treatment (Visit 5) will be performed blinded at a central laboratory according to a laboratory manual. At both visits, 6 biopsy samples will be taken, 2 each from the proximal, mid, and distal segment of the esophagus. Additionally, patients will rate the dysphagia and odynophagia severity score daily on a 11-point NRS (numeric rating scale): 0 = 'no symptoms' to 10 = 'worst possible symptoms'. Patients will assess the severity score of the actual day in the patient diary daily after IMP intake starting on Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute change in dysphagia and odynophagia severity scores from Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 28 days after Visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate the dysphagia and odynophagia severity score daily on a 11-point NRS (numeric rating scale): 0 = 'no symptoms' to 10 = 'worst possible symptoms'. Patients will assess the severity score of the actual day in the patient diary daily after IMP intake starting on Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative change in dysphagia and odynophagia severity scores from Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 28 days after Visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate the dysphagia and odynophagia severity score daily on a 11-point NRS (numeric rating scale): 0 = 'no symptoms' to 10 = 'worst possible symptoms'. Patients will assess the severity score of the actual day in the patient diary daily after IMP intake starting on Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to achieve symptom relief (defined as 50 percent improvement in the dysphagia or odynophagia symptoms on an NRS compared to Baseline)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 28 days after Visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate the dysphagia and odynophagia severity score daily on a 11-point NRS (numeric rating scale): 0 = 'no symptoms' to 10 = 'worst possible symptoms'. Patients will assess the severity score of the actual day in the patient diary daily after IMP intake starting on Day 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the EREFS from Baseline to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 2) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 4-7 weeks after Visit 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The EREFS score (Eosinophilic esophagitis endoscopic reference score) is a classification and grading system for the endoscopic assessment of the esophageal features of eosinophilic esophagitis. The grading is used either to assess the severity of endoscopic findings from 0=´none´ to 2 or 3=´severe´ or to classify 0=´absent´ or 1=´present´.The total score will be calculated and compared between Baseline and end of treatment. A higher score correlates with more severe eosinophilic esophagitis symptoms.
All Adverse Events occurring from the first investigational medicinal product administration onwards are defined as treatment-emergent Adverse Events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: All Serious Adverse Events occurring from the first investigational medicinal product administration onwards are defined as treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 5 = 28 days after Visit 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The local tolerability of the IMP administration will be evaluated daily throughout the treatment period in the patient diary. Patients should indicate whether they had any discomfort in mouth, throat or esophagus while taking IMP on a VAS (Visual analog scale) ranging from 'no discomfort' to 'the worst imaginable discomfort'. The first assessment on Day 0 recorded in the patient diary after IMP intake will be considered Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-reported treatment satisfaction at end of treatment based on questions about handling, taste, and time necessary for administration
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked to answer a questionnaire about their satisfaction with the IMP treatment at Visit 5. Questions will cover the general satisfaction with the IMP, the swallowability of the IMP, and the frequency of administration. Answers involve gradings from 0 (the best outcome) to 3 or 4 (the worst outcome) plus an indication for the preference of single or multiple administrations of the investigated product.

arm_group.description: Oral use of 1 hard gelatin capsule (800 μg)
Oral use of 1 hard gelatin capsule

intervention.description: Daily administration in the evening at bedtime for 28 days
Daily administration in the evening at bedtime for 28 days
